ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English snesen, an alteration of fnese 'to snort, sneeze' (akin to Old High German fnāsan 'to snort'), perhaps influenced by Old Norse hnjósa 'to sneeze'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Intransitive verb: a verb that does not take a direct object
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To expel air forcibly and audibly from the nose and mouth due to irritation of the nasal mucous membrane.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 因鼻腔黏膜受到刺激而突然且不由自主地通过口鼻喷出空气。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He sneezed loudly when he walked into the dusty room.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他走进满是灰尘的房间时，大声打了个喷嚏。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An act or sound of sneezing.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She tried to suppress a sneeze during the quiet concert.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 在安静的音乐会期间，她试图忍住一个喷嚏。
